title: MIME type
summary: A MIME type (now properly called "media type", but also sometimes "content type") is a string sent along with a file indicating the type of the file (describing the content format, for example, a sound file might be labeled audio/ogg, or an image file image/png).

parents.title: MDN Web Docs Glossary: Definitions of Web-related terms
